intro: Rungia schliebenii, commonly known as the scarlet poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes other plants with similar morphological features. Rungia schliebenii thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. Its foliage is typically dark green, and it prefers well-drained soil with partial shade.
